page.title: 02Whalley & District,Lancs.(2)
page.content: The village of{Whalley}is surrounded in every direction by green fields and quite dense woodlands. One mile to the north of Whalley lies the tiny village of{Wiswell} almost hidden from view by the neighbouring{Spring Wood. { }To the north-west lies the hospital of{Calderstones,}established for the care and training of the mentally handicapped. Travelling south-westwards out of Whalley you will pass through {Billington,}a residential area of private and council housing estates. Running almost north to south across the area and almost parallel to each other are the{A59 (Liverpool/York) trunk road, which now bypasses the village, and the{Blackburn/Hellifield railway line, crossing the impressive {Whalley Viaduct}with its 49 arches.
